issues.description: [Self Referential Documentation] Readers might struggle to understand the actual implementation details. Evidence: Documentation describing its own analysis method lacks clear user-focused explanation (Source: Nielsen Norman Group UX Writing Guidelines)
issues.suggestion: Provide concrete example of how Cognitive Load Theory is applied. Before: "Cognitive Load Theory (Nielsen Norman Group): Identifies sentences >25 words" → After: "Cognitive Load Theory helps simplify complex text. For example, this analyzer flags sentences over 25 words that might overwhelm readers, like technic..."
issues.context: Cognitive Load Theory (Nielsen Norman Group): Identifies sentences >25 words

issues.description: [Imprecise Quantification] Readers cannot precisely budget or plan cost estimations. Evidence: Cost range uses inexact language and lacks specific context (Source: Google Technical Writing Best Practices)
issues.suggestion: Add more precise cost breakdown, include per-file and total project estimates. Before: "~$0.14-0.20 for 60 files" → After: "Estimated cost: $0.14-$0.20 per file, totaling $8.40-$12.00 for a 60-file documentation set. Actual costs may vary based on file complexity."
issues.context: Cost Impact: Haiku: Still budget-friendly at ~$0.14-0.20 for 60 files

issues.description: [Missing Context] Developers cannot understand how to implement these configuration settings. Evidence: Configuration example lacks explanation of environment setup (Source: Rosenfeld & Morville Information Architecture Principles)
issues.suggestion:
Add comprehensive setup instructions and explain each configuration parameter. Before: "# .env configuration
CLAUDE_MODEL=claude-3-5-haiku-20241022" → After: "# Environment Configuration for AI Documentation Analyzer
# Select AI model and set maximum token limit
# Recommended: Use .env file in project root
C..."
issues.context: # .env configuration CLAUDE_MODEL=claude-3-5-haiku-20241022

issues.description: [Incomplete Citation] Researchers cannot easily verify or locate original sources. Evidence: References lack specific publication dates or direct links (Source: Academic Citation Best Practices)
issues.suggestion: Add full citations with publication years, links, and specific reference points. Before: "- Nielsen Norman Group: UX research, information scent, cognitive load" → After: "- Nielsen Norman Group (2023): 'Cognitive Load in Technical Documentation', UX Research Report, https://www.nngroup.com/articles/cognitive-load-resear..."
issues.context: Research Sources Referenced

issues.description: [Missing Context] Readers cannot immediately understand the scope or purpose of the documentation. Evidence: No immediate context about what this document covers or what project/system it relates to (Source: Redish, J. (2007) Task-Oriented Writing Principles)
issues.suggestion:
Add a brief one-sentence summary explaining the purpose and primary audience. Before: "# Infrastructure & Deployment Guide" → After: "# Documentation Analyzer Infrastructure & Deployment Guide

*Technical documentation analysis tool for evaluating markdown documentation quality*"
issues.context: # Infrastructure & Deployment Guide

issues.description: [Cognitive Load] Readers might struggle to parse the multiple concepts presented simultaneously. Evidence: Sentence contains multiple complex concepts without clear separation (Source: Nielsen Norman Group Cognitive Load Principles)
issues.suggestion: Split into two clear, concise sentences. Before: "This project is now fully containerized and follows security best practices for easy deployment and ..." → After: "This project is fully containerized. It follows comprehensive security best practices to simplify deployment and development workflows."
issues.context: This project is now fully containerized and follows security best practices for easy deployment and development.

issues.description: [Ambiguous Instruction] Users cannot easily understand how to configure AI analysis modes. Evidence: No clear, step-by-step guidance on how to enable/disable AI modes (Source: Wroblewski, L. (2010) Web Form Design: Filling in the Blanks)
issues.suggestion:
Provide explicit configuration steps with environment variable explanation. Before: "With AI: Full analysis using Claude API / Without AI: Basic analysis (no API key required)" → After: "### AI Analysis Modes
- **Full Mode**: Requires Claude API key
  - Set `ENABLE_AI_ANALYSIS=true`
  - Provide `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` in .env

- **Basic Mo..."
issues.context: With AI: Full analysis using Claude API / Without AI: Basic analysis (no API key required)

issues.description: [Undefined Jargon] Readers might not understand what constitutes a 'Full Mode'. Evidence: 'Full Mode' is not explicitly defined or contextualized (Source: Plain Language Guidelines, plainlanguage.gov)
issues.suggestion:
Define mode characteristics and differentiate from basic mode. Before: "### Full Mode (With API Key)
- ✓ All quality checks
- ✓ AI-powered clarity analysis
..." → After: "### Full Mode (AI-Enhanced Analysis)
*Comprehensive documentation analysis leveraging AI capabilities*

**What's Different:**
- Advanced AI-powered qu..."
issues.context: Full Mode (With API Key)
